title: When was the last time all four Beatles were together? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Beatles finished Abbey Road on August 20, 1969. That’s the last time all 4 were in the studio together. August 22, 1969 was the last time all 4 gathered for a photo shoot. It was at Lennon’s Tittenhurst Park estate. The last time all 4 were together is not known as of this date in 2019. Most historians say that it was between September 15–19, 1969 due to many business meetings at Apple. September 20, 1969 was the day that The Beatles signed the new royalty contract with Capitol Records negotiated by Beatles manager, Allen Klein. Harrison missed this meeting…going to visit his sick mother. George signed later. This was also the day that John Lennon told the others that he was leaving The Beatles. McCartney & Klein told Lennon that telling the press his decision would be harmful for business. John agreed to keep the news quiet. P…G…& R would call each other during the fall & winter and wonder if John would change his mind. Around this time…Paul started working on his first solo album,”McCartney”. Upon the release Paul told the press that The Beatles were basically over on April 10, 1970. During the 1970’s they would get together in 2’s and 3’s for recording on different Beatles solo albums and Lennon hung out with Paul & Ringo at his beach house in Santa Monica in March/April 1974. As far as we know..all 4 were together for the last time between Sept.15–19, 1969 at the Apple office in London.

There is some dispute about this. Their last day in the studio together was Aug. 20 1969, when they recorded overdubs for I Want You (She's So Heavy). On Aug. 22 they did a photo shoot at Lennon's home at Tittenhurst Park, their final group photos. Several later meetings where they discussed business and later their breakup did not have all of them in one place. A promotional film for Something was shot October-ish, but the members appear with their wives, never together. Some sessions for Let It Be were done in 1970, but Lennon did not participate. They met in twos and threes at various concerts and parties over the next decade, and all contributed to Ringo's 1973 album, but again never all at once. Even their final legal dissolution was done remotely. A few sources claim otherwise, but there is no definitive proof of all four ever assembling after that photo session on Aug. 22 1969.

August 20, 1969, was the last time the four Beatles were together . It was in the recording studio. You could stretch it and say November 23, 1995 as that's when the Anthology was done with Paul McCartney, George Harrison, Ritchie Starkey, and John Lennon appearing posthumously. Three flesh and blood Beatles with one in spirit. I like to feel that they were together for that.

There are some claims that it was August 20th, 1969 in Apple Studios as they recorded the final over-dubs for the song ‘I Want You (She’s So Heavy)’ that would appear on Abbey Road (the album). But actually August 22nd, 1969 was the final date as they posed for the photo shoot at Tittenhurst Park — which is the known date for the photo shoot. I believe the misconception that arises when people say August 20th is due to the fact that it was the last time they were all in the studio together. But August 22nd was the last known time they were all together, ever.

Probably during the recording of their last album Abbey Road in 1969. The break up in 1970 was very acrimonious where McCartney fell out with the other 3 and was lambasted by Lennon on a track called “How do you Sleep” from his Imagine album in 1971. Its said Lennon and McCartney eventually made up and got back in touch shortly before Lennon was murdered in 1980. However, as a foursome, don't think they were ever all seen together since 1969. Paul, George and Ringo did get together to record the Beatles Anthology in the late 80s, early 90s, about 10 years after Lennon's death.

According to You Never Give Me Your Money by Peter Doggett the last time they were all in a room together was an awful seemingly endless meeting with their respective lawyers, and respective managers Allen Klein and Lee Eastman either 16th or 17th September 1969. This was not the occasion when John said he “ain't no fucking Beatle “, George was not present on that occasion. Another great book about The Beatles.

Mark Anater wrote a comprehensive answer and I would just like to add the following: in mid September 1969 there were business meetings at Apple Records during which all four were present, but most of it was taken up by bickering between Lennon and Harrison about the latter’s contribution to future Beatles albums. On September 20 when Lennon announced he wanted a “divorce” from The Beatles, Harrison was not present.

The last session for the Beatles in the studio was to record “The End” on the Abbey Road album. It is really sad to think that song really was the end in more ways than one. However, when they were last in a room together is up for debate. Promoters were offering millions of dollars for just one concert from the Beatles before Lennon’s assassination. There was business meetings and all. It had to be discussed at one time. I will never know the exact last time. None of the Beatles have confirmed it in interviews.

The last time all four Beatles were together was on 8/20/1969. They were all together in a recording studio. The last time all four played together was 01/30/1969. They performed on the roof of the five storey Apple Corps Headquarters in London. The album and film of this performance were released in May, 1970 as Let It Be.

In the studio, I believe it was in late August, 1969, for a mixing session for Abbey Road. As far as all four together for a meeting, it was probably late September, 1969, when John announced he was leaving the group. I’m not sure if all four were there or not, but I know Paul was.
The last photo of the Beatles together.
August 22, 1969 The Beatles met at John’s Ascot home for what would become their last photo session.

I think it was 1969. I remember seeing them on tv and they all looked like hell, not into it. This was around the time that Paul and Linda Eastman got together, and Yoko and John got together, so there you go. It just kind of fell apart after that.

A rather interesting question there, Jim, thanks for including me M8 in the folks you tagged to make a response to it. Cheers! Hopefully, the accompanying link will be helpful —→ When was the last time all four Beatles met together in person Rest In Peace, John & George —→

As far as playing together, I’m not certain, but I think maybe the rooftop concert at Abbey Road studios. Maybe the last time together period was at the lawyers’ office. Don’t know for sure, but that’s probably close.

1969 -there are some other answers here from people that know more than me. Question scared me tho. It was sort of cut off when it popped up. I was afraid you were asking about The Beach Boys (who are supposedly still playing live gigs). That would be a hard , complicated , controversial question.

Well, creatively it was at the end of the Abbey Road recording sessions in September or so of 1969. However, they were in business meetings together at some points in 1970 when they were officially ending as a group. Probably in April of 1970.

ALL FOUR TOGETHER? Would have to be, 1970. The year the Band broke up. But all THREE TOGETHER. When they did ANTHOLOGY. BUT JOHN WAS THERE IN SPIRIT, Because they added his voice to the LP. So there you go. ALL FOUR OF THEM. 1970. Annie 10/28/20
I have heard that it was actually in 1970 to record “Because” I cannot say if Ringo was there or not - he may have been It was the last Song they recorded for Abbey Road

There last public performance, was the famous brief concert during the day, on the top of their Apple Corps building in London on January 30, 1969. They were playing to an audience in nearby buildings and the streets below.
A very good question. I am not sure if the 4 were ever together after finishing Abbey Road. Is there anyone out there know of any get together the Beatles had in the ‘70’s?
The last time that all four Beatles were photographed together was on 22 August 1969 at Johns home in Ascot
I believe it was in August 1969 when they met up for a photo session.
The last time all four were together was in August of 1969.
Was it not September 69 when the group listened to the final version of the album in the studio before its release ?
